meanings.meaning: 1. opportunity; chance; occasion; time esp. 折お暇の折にはぜひ遊びに来てください。Do come and see us when you are free.
2. folding; fold; pleat; crease esp. 折り
3. small food box (wooden or cardboard) esp. 折り
4. folding in ... (two, three, etc.) as 二つ折り, 三つ折り, etc.; number indicates the number of layers after folding
5. counter for folded items
6. counter for items (esp. food) packed in an oribako See also 折り箱
折り 【おり】
1. opportunity; chance; occasion; time esp. 折お暇の折にはぜひ遊びに来てください。Do come and see us when you are free.
2. folding; fold; pleat; crease esp. 折り
3. small food box (wooden or cardboard) esp. 折り
4. folding in ... (two, three, etc.) as 二つ折り, 三つ折り, etc.; number indicates the number of layers after folding
5. counter for folded items
6. counter for items (esp. food) packed in an oribako See also 折り箱
折り 【おり】

sentences.translation: Do come and see us when you are free.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to break; to fracture; to break off; to snap off; to pick (e.g. flowers) 最後のわら一本がらくだの背骨を折る。The last straw breaks the camel's back.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to fold; to bend 折ろうとしても指が弱くなりすぎていた。Her fingers were too weak to fold it.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to make (origami)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to interrupt; to end See also 筆を折る

meanings.meaning: 1. to break; to be broken; to snap; to fracture
2. to be folded
3. to give in; to back down; to yield; to submit ついにバス会社が折れた。At last, the bus company gave in.
4. to turn (a corner) See also 曲がる

3. to give in; to back down; to yield; to submit ついにバス会社が折れた。At last, the bus company gave in.

meanings.meaning: 1. with trouble; at great pains Usually written using kana aloneせっかくの苦労もあだになった。All my pains went for nothing.

meanings.type: Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'
meanings.meaning: 2. rare; valuable; precious; long-awaited Usually written using kana aloneお前が大声出すから、せっかくのシャッターチャンスを逃しちゃったよ。You just made me miss the perfect shot when you hollered.

meanings.type: Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no'
meanings.meaning: 3. kind; generous Usually written using kana aloneこういう事情ですから、残念ながら、せっかくのご招待をお受けいたしかねるのです。As such is the case, I am sorry I can't accept your kind invitation.
4. specially; especially; expressly Usually written using kana aloneせっかく雨の中を会いに行ったのに彼女は留守だった。Though I went to see her all the way in the rain, she was out.
切角 【せっかく】
切角: Ateji (phonetic) reading, Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: All my pains went for nothing.
You just made me miss the perfect shot when you hollered.
As such is the case, I am sorry I can't accept your kind invitation.
Though I went to see her all the way in the rain, she was out.
